p: Measurement of the quantitative characteristics has revealed that the length of the leaves ranged between 19 and 42 mm (with an average of 30.81 ± 1,215 in FEZ and between 19 and 40 mm (with an average of 29.46 ± 0,451) in Safi, while their width ranged between 15 and 30 mm in FES and between 19 and 40 mm for SAFI. Petiole length ranged from 3 to 9 mm for Safi and from 3 to 8 mm for Safi ( Table 1). The stipule of the leaves has been modified in spines to adapt to their habitat. The spines could reach 2-5 mm in length of a yellow/orange color, generally oriented downwards (Part I, Figure 2(b)).
